===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|とも|tr1=tomo|t1=with; both|に|tr2=ni|pos2=adverbial particle}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Use of the single kanji {{lang|ja|与}} to spell this phrase is very rare and archaic, and is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]].

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|と|もに}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{ja-accent-common|a|と|もに}}<ref name="DJR"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[to̞mo̞ ni]}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|ja|ともに}}, {{l|ja|共に}}, {{l|ja|倶に}}
: The more common spellings are {{l|ja|ともに}} and {{l|ja|共に}}.

===Adverb===
{{ja-pos|adverb|とも に}}

# {{ja-def|共に}} [[together]], [[with]], [[both]]
